question: If I see a queue at the school’s common washing area during lunch, I will push students to get ahead.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: Showing respect while waiting in a queue is considered decent and polite behavior.

question: If I have a question in class, I will wait for my turn by raising my hand.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: Many students like speaking in class. So to give a chance to all, raising your hand is highly effective.

question: If I wear clothes that other kids don’t appreciate, I will ask my parents to buy me some other clothes.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: Buying new clothes because of others’ opinions is not ideal for self-esteem. Buy new clothes only if you personally don’t appreciate what you’re wearing.

question: If my parents bought me a present before my birthday, I will open it only on my birthday.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: Gift-giving is an emotional process as it is bought with love and affection. Opening it on time shows respect and politeness.

question: If I have something to say to my friends, I will interrupt the speaker.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: Communicating with friends in a friendly discussion is about listening as well as speaking.

question: If I have something I really like for dessert, I will eat it before lunch time.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: School time has a timetable. All students should respect the schedule, and practicing patience for dessert might just make it more delicious!

question: When my peers make fun of my inexpensive shoes, I will practice patience and understanding.
Reasons: Reasons for the ideal response: What others think or say does not matter. Understanding their behavior will personally help you grow further.
